cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles WNW of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to turn north‐northwest and parallel the southeast U.S. coast toward Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast coast of Florida (around West Palm Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for the Northwestern Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warnings for the Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks and Caicos, Southeastern and Central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas lies within or near the forecast cone
weather_observation.wind: Potential for tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) with highest cumulative probability of 12% Monday; gusts could reach 40–55 mph along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the storm hugs the coast as a hurricane, surge of 2–4 ft above normal tide levels is possible along the Georgia and South Carolina barrier islands including Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 2–5 inches, locally higher, Monday into Monday night with a risk of flash flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and rip currents beginning late Sunday; possible temporary channel restrictions and berth closures due to rising water levels and strong currents.
